snippet: Reports on employment, the services industry and productivity as well as the Fed’s Beige Book snapshot of the economy all showed vitality. The momentum, however, did not carry over into wages.
abstract: Reports on private sector employment and the services sector show strong growth, suggesting slowing global economy is having limited impact on domestic activity; evidence of economy's resilience is backed by Federal Reserve's Beige Book.
lead_paragraph: Reports on employment, the services industry and productivity as well as the Fed’s Beige Book snapshot of the economy all showed vitality. The momentum, however, did not carry over into wages.

headline.main: An Assortment of Data Shows a Resurgent U.S. Economy, but Wages Continue to Lag
headline.print_headline: An Assortment of Data Shows a Resurgent U.S. Economy, but Wages Continue to Lag
